text:
How did the Pulkovo Observatory work in 1940? Watch the archive video about the solar telescope üî≠
06 Nov 2019 by Anastasia Rozhkova
A short Soviet video about the work of the Pulkovo Observatory in St. Petersburg in 1940 was published on the YouTube channel Archive of Film and Photo Documents.
The video is part of a film document called Pioneer No. 13 and lasts a little over two minutes. The video tells how the observatory specialists designed a special telescope for shooting the sun. The device is shown in the frame.



"Pioneer" is a newsreel that has been published in the USSR since 1931. The issues also talked about children's river flotilla, holidays in pioneer camps and hobbies of schoolchildren.
